description: This recipe from Delish.com is truly the Best-Ever Farro Salad.
headline: Best-Ever Farro Salad
keywords: farro, farro salad recipes, how to cook farro, easy vinaigrette
name: Best-Ever Farro Salad

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium saucepan, combine farro, vegetable broth, salt, and bay leaf.
Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and let cook, stirring occasionally, until farro is tender and no broth remains, about 30 minutes.
When farro is cooked, transfer to a large bowl to cool.
In the meantime, make fried shallots: in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine oil and shallots.
When the shallots begin to bubble, reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until shallots are golden and crisp, 15 to 20 minutes.
Remove shallots from oil with a slotted spoon and place on a paper-towel lined plate and season with salt.
Make dressing: in a medium bowl, combine the cooled olive oil with vinegar, mustard, and honey and season with salt and pepper.
Assemble salad: combine cooked farro, crispy shallots, arugula, apple, parmesan, basil, parsley, and pecans.

review.reviewBody: Outstanding.  Normally, I "doctor" recipes, but this one was perfect, as is. I will be making it again.  Very satisfying lunch to eat at room temp.  I may add both baby spinach and arugula next time, but the arugula is really key - adds a peppery bite that goes well with the sweet notes.  I also think that dried cranberries would be a nice addition for both color and sweetness.
Absolutely incredible salad. Wouldn’t change a thing.

I just made this tonight, and it’s a big hit! We used barley instead of farro, and it still turned out great. We had to split it into half since it’s too much food for three people. This dish is easy to make, and it’s really delicious!
This lives up to its name. Delicious! To really take it home, sauté a fillet of salmon and mix it in. We’ll be making this again. Thanks so much!

This has to be my favorite recipe. I made it for a potluck and my friend's food snob husband asked for the recipe, it's now in their regular potluck/party rotation, too. 

The parmesan really adds to the salad, but I've made the recipe without it (sometimes for vegan friends, sometimes because it wasn't on hand) and it's still amazing. 

I came back to this recipe today for the fried shallots and dressing - I drizzled it over pan fried purple potatoes and mushrooms and finished with the shallots on top. So good!

I love this salad!  The first time I made it exactly as written...perfect!  The second time I made some substitutions to use ingredients I had on hand—dried cranberries and apricots instead of apples, pepitas and walnuts instead of pecans.  It is now my go-to when I am asked to bring a dish.

This is fabulous! I did add a thinly sliced blood orange but otherwise I followed the recipe as written. Served with cold roasted chicken breasts and fresh fruit, we had an outstanding meal, my husband asked that I add this to the rotation.
